message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper deals with action recognition in videos using deep Convolutional Networks (ConvNets). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the use of multi-task learning, which falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of optical flow for training the ConvNets can be categorized under cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper also discusses the generalization of hand-crafted features, which can be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses the evaluation of the proposed architecture on standard video action benchmarks, which can be categorized under cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
